./.title: Introduction
./.body:
Gripper
Gripper is a helper machine used to bootstrap new modules in projects based on our new modular architecture.
In order to use Gripper call the New-FeatureModule, New-FoundationModule or New-ProjectModule cmdlet without any parameters from your Package Manager Console in Visual Studio. You will be asked three questions:

What is the name of your module? It is a plain name of the module, i.e. Identity.
Whether to add a test project to your module? The available options are y (yes) or n (no).

Be careful: Gripper installs nuget packages from both sources - nuget.org and our Unic Team City. They must be present on your package sources list in Visual Studio and the All must be selected for the package sources.
Configuration



Key
Description
Example




GripperCodeProjectNugetPackages
A list of packages which willd be installed to the code project
    


GripperCodeTemplate
The path to the folder containing a template for code projects.
src\Templates\Code\


GripperCodeVisualStudioProjectPath
The path to the *proj file inside the project template (default: ProjectName.csproj)
ProjectName\ProjectName.xproj


GripperTestProjectNugetPackages
A list of packages which will be installed to the test project
    


GripperTestTemplate
The path to the folder containing a template for test projects.
src\Templates\Code\


GripperTestVisualStudioProjectPath
The path to the *proj file inside the project template for the test template (default: ProjectName.csproj)
ProjectName\ProjectName.xproj



Templates
You can create your own templates for your solution. Basically a template is a folder which gets transformed to the destination folder.
The folder must contain a file called ProjectName.csproj.
The following words can be used in a template and will be replaced:
| Name | Description |
| --- | --- |
| ProjectName | The name of the project without the ending ".csproj" |
| ModuleName | The name of the module typed by the user | 
| ModuleType | The type of the module. Normally either Project, Foundation or Feature |

api/.title: Gripper - API
api/.body:
Gripper - API
New-FeatureModule
Creates new projects for a new feature module according to our architecture guidelines.    
New-FeatureModule []
 Read more
New-FoundationModule
Creates new projects for a new foundation module according to our architecture guidelines.    
New-FoundationModule []
 Read more
New-ProjectModule
Creates new projects for a new project module according to our architecture guidelines.    
New-ProjectModule []
 Read more
New-ScHabitatModule
Creates new projects for a new module according to our architecture guidelines.    
New-ScHabitatModule [-moduleType]  []
 Read more
New-ScHelixModule
Creates new projects for a new module according to our architecture guidelines.    
New-ScHelixModule [-moduleType]  []
 Read more

api/New-FeatureModule.html.title: New-FeatureModule
api/New-FeatureModule.html.body:
New-FeatureModule
Creates new projects for a new feature module according to our architecture guidelines.
Syntax
New-FeatureModule []
Description
Creates new projects for a new feature module according to our architecture guidelines. You will be asked a few questions and Gripper will create new projects 
in proper directories in the file system and Visual Studio solution.
Parameters
Examples
-------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
New-FeatureModule

api/New-ScHabitatModule.html.title: New-ScHabitatModule
api/New-ScHabitatModule.html.body:
New-ScHabitatModule
Creates new projects for a new module according to our architecture guidelines.
Syntax
New-ScHabitatModule [-moduleType]  []
Description
Creates new projects for a new module according to our architecture guidelines. You will be asked a few questions and Gripper will create new projects 
in proper directories in the file system and Visual Studio solution.
Parameters
-moduleType 
The type of the module to bootstrap.



Position
Required
Default value
Accept pipeline input
Accept wildchard characters




1
true

false
false




Examples
-------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
New-ScHabitatModule "Feature"

CHANGELOG.html.title: Changelog
CHANGELOG.html.body:
Gripper
1.0

Initial release on GH
Support for Gitbook 3

0.6

Added possibility to create project templates per solution by adding config keys:
GripperCodeTemplate
GripperCodeVisualStudioProjectPath
GripperTestTemplate
GripperTestVisualStudioProjectPath


Removed switch for the test project creation. The test project will always be create except for "Project" modules

0.5

No NuGet package is installed anymore. Instead you need to configure which one are installed in Bob.config with the keys GripperCodeProjectNugetPackages and GripperTestProjectNugetPackages 
Renamed Habitat to Helix
Updated the theme

0.4

Updated docs

0.3

Replaced one big cmdlet with three smaller ones: New-FeatureModule, New-FoundationModule and New-ProjectModule
Removed unicorn configuration files from boilerplates
Changed runtime to .NET 4.6

0.2

Removed debug and release web configuration files from project templates

0.1

Initital version
